newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume slips, prices mixed.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume slips, prices mixed.

text.p: Istanbul gold exchange volume slipped to 387 kilos on Monday from Friday's 642 kilos as demand fell on the free-market, dealers said.
Gold closed easier in dollar terms at $347.50 an ounce from $350 on Friday but rose in lira terms to 1,453,500 lira per gram versus the previous 1,443,900, as the lira fell against the dollar.
The Turkish currency closed at 129,770 lira to the dollar compared to 128,340 on Friday.
Of the day's trade, 262 kilos of gold changed hands in the morning session and 380 kilos in the afternoon and 41.6 percent of trade was conducted in lira terms.
